reviews.review_msg: Dr. Adcock is an excellent prof! Highly recommended. Very helpful and friendly. 323 doesn't necessarily have the most interesting content but she manages to make it entertaining. Workload and readings were reasonable for a 300 level class. Mark was based on the final exam, a book review, longer term essay, and tutorial participation. No midterm.

Prof. Adcock's passion for Canadian history is contagious. 'The Canadian Prairies' had the potential to be quite a dry course, but she made the subject matter engaging. All lectures were well organized and packed with information; hand cramps from writing were a common occurrence. Prof. Adcock is kind and wants her students to succeed!

Leier was unorganized and unhelpful, not only did he hand out the syllabus a month into the class but he gave no feedback whatsoever throughout the semester. Weekly reflections and lectures were useless, the textbooks readings were never discussed, and the final presentation was loosely guided and worth half of your grade. Avoid at all costs
